law.catch_line: Authority membership -- Qualifications -- Terms -- Compensation -- Officers.

text.section: Members of a Stream Restoration and Mitigation Authority established under KRS 151.610 to 151.615 shall reside or have a real property interest in the given watershed and shall serve as ex officio members of the 2020 water management planning councils established under KRS 151.601(1) that lie within a given watershed.

Members shall serve four (4) year terms, except the first members of the authority shall serve for terms of years as follows:
Four (4) members shall serve for a term of four (4) years;
Four (4) members shall serve for a term of three (3) years; and
The remaining members shall serve for a term of two (2) years.
Members of the authority may be reappointed. A vacancy in an unexpired term shall be filled for the unexpired portion of the term in the same manner as the original appointment to that term.
Members of the authority shall serve without pay but may be reimbursed by the authority, as fiscal resources allow, for reasonable expenses incurred to carry out their work.

Each authority shall elect officers to serve annual terms, adopt bylaws, and establish an annual budget and, when appropriate, may establish advisory committees and policies it deems necessary for the authority's operation.
The authority may remove any member at the member's request or due to poor attendance at meetings.

law.history: Created 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 97, sec. 4, effective July 15, 2008.
